The August Sage Lord declares: The Square Cauldron holds the Hidden Writ of Mysterious Plain Purple Names. Those who comprehend it shall ascend to the Palace of the Square Cauldron. Whoever bears it shall have their name inscribed in mysterious plain script upon purple tablets. After nine years of flight, divine immortals shall guard and welcome them, with the Five Peaks recording their name.

*Written in azure on white silk.*

**The Crimson Names and Hidden Writ of the Jade Register of the Grand Clarity**
The August Sage Lord declares: The Jade Register of the Grand Clarity bears the Hidden Writ of Crimson Names. Those who comprehend it shall traverse the Grand Clarity in flight, soaring in radiance to the Jasper Palace. Whoever bears it shall have their name inscribed in crimson upon the Jade Register. After nine years, they shall attain communion with the divine and traverse the skies, attended by twelve jade lads.

*Written in cinnabar on white silk.*

**The Golden Names and Hidden Writ of the Jasper Tablet of the Grand Plain**
The August Sage Lord declares: The Jasper Tablet of the Grand Plain bears the Hidden Writ of Golden Names. Those who comprehend it shall ascend to the Palace of the Grand Plain and pay homage to the Three Primordial Lords. Whoever bears it shall have their name inscribed upon the Jasper Tablet. After nine years, flying clouds shall descend, and they shall ascend to heaven in broad daylight.

*Written in yellow on white silk.*

**The Crimson Script and Purple Register of the Southern Culmen**
The August Sage Lord declares: The Southern Culmen holds the supreme writ of Crimson Script and Purple Register. Those who comprehend it shall ascend in broad daylight to pay homage to the Upper Primordial of the Southern Culmen. Whoever bears it shall have their name recorded in the Purple Register by the Southern Culmen. After nine years, the Three Primordial Lords shall descend to bestow upon them the True Writ, and they shall ascend to heaven in broad daylight.

*Written in cinnabar on white silk.*

**The Hidden Writ of Azure Gold and Crimson Script of the Upper Primordial of the Mysterious Palace**
The August Sage Lord declares: The Hidden Writ of Azure Gold and Crimson Script resides in the Upper Primordial of the Mysterious Palace. Those who comprehend it shall ascend to the Cloud Palace, soaring in radiance to the Upper Clarity. Whoever bears it shall behold the true form of the Upper Primordial. After nine years, omens shall descend to their chamber, and they shall be granted the True Writ, thereby attaining divine transcendence.

*Written in azure on white silk.*

**The Hidden Writ of White Jade and Golden Characters of the Cinnabar Terrace of the Mysterious Capital**
The August Sage Lord declares: The Cinnabar Terrace of the Mysterious Capital holds the Hidden Writ of White Jade and Golden Characters. Those who comprehend it shall ascend in broad daylight to the Mysterious Capital. Whoever bears it shall have their name inscribed upon the Cinnabar Terrace. After nine years, they shall traverse the void in flight, and in time, attain divine transcendence.

*Written in yellow on white silk.*

**The Hidden Writ of Azure Script on Jade Tablets of the Three Primordials’ Palace**
The August Sage Lord declares: The Jade Tablets of the Three Primordials’ Palace bear the Hidden Writ of Azure Script. Those who comprehend it shall ascend to heaven in broad daylight to pay homage to the Three Primordial Lords. Whoever bears it shall have their name inscribed upon the Jasper Tablets. After nine years, the Three Primordials shall visit their chamber to bestow the True Writ, and they shall traverse the skies as divine immortals.

*Written in azure on white silk.*

**The Hidden Writ of Mysterious Names and Registers within the Mysterious Dipper**
The August Sage Lord declares: Within the Mysterious Dipper lies the Hidden Writ of Mysterious Names and Registers. Those who comprehend it shall ascend into the Mysterious Dipper and traverse the skies to the Palace of the Upper Clarity. Their name shall be inscribed within the Mysterious Dipper. After nine years, divine beings shall descend to bestow the True Writ, and they shall attain divine transcendence.

*Written in black on white silk.*

**The Crimson Script and Purple Register of Jade Tablets within the Five Peaks**
The August Sage Lord declares: The Five Peaks hold the Crimson Script and Purple Register of Jade Tablets. Those who comprehend it shall ascend to heaven in broad daylight and traverse the skies above the Five Peaks. Transcendent officials shall guard their person, and the Five Emperors shall inscribe their name upon the tablets of the Five Peaks. After nine years, they shall traverse the void in flight and ascend to the Mysterious Palace.

*Written in azure on white silk.*

All hidden writs are the scriptures of the Primordial Void of Antiquity, marking those who attain the Dao and unite with transcendence. Whoever obtains and beholds these texts shall be monitored by the Four Poles, commended by the Five Emperors, attended by ten thousand spirits, and revered by the host of perfected beings. Those who comprehend their resonance shall traverse the skies to the Upper Clarity, where the Three Primordials shall descend to ascend with them. Whoever bears these texts shall have their name inscribed upon the Mysterious Chart, attended by twelve jade lads and twelve jade maidens, roaming the Five Peaks, treading the renowned mountains, with the ten realms bowing in homage and ten thousand immortals coming to pay tribute. After nine years, they shall naturally attain profound clarity of its resonance, converse with divine beings, ride clouds and tread the void, traversing the vastness of the heavens.

**The Supreme Sage’s Method for Inscribing Names upon the Golden Pavilion’s Jade Register and Traversing the Skies to the Upper Clarity**
The August Sage Lord declares: To inscribe one’s name upon the Golden Pavilion’s Jade Register and traverse the skies to the Upper Clarity, one must, on the first day of the first month, write in cinnabar the ten sounds of the Hidden Writ of Golden Names upon the Jade Register, face the *yin* direction to ingest it, knock the teeth twelve times, and softly intone:

*"The vast qi of heaven’s essence weaves the forms of the Five Mornings,
Inheriting the governance of the Primordial Void of Antiquity,
Inscribed in the Golden Pavilion’s records,
Uniting with the Upper Primordial’s jubilation,
The Celestial Ford unfurls its glory.
Ingesting the Hidden Writ, the body ascends to the Jade Clarity,
Profoundly comprehending the natural,
Uniting with the Emperor in numinosity."*

Upon completion, swallow the qi nine times, perform nine bows, and pay homage to the August Emperor of the Golden Pavilion before ceasing. After nine years of practice, one’s name shall be inscribed in the Golden Pavilion’s records and etched upon the Jade Tablet, naturally attaining clarity of the celestial script and merging with the Emperor.

**The Supreme Sage’s Method for Inscribing Names upon the Golden Script and Jade Register of the Upper Clarity and Traversing the Skies to Its Palace**
The August Sage Lord declares: To inscribe one’s name upon the Golden Script and Jade Register of the Upper Clarity and traverse the skies to its palace, one must, on the second day of the second month, write in azure the ten sounds of the Golden Tablet and Jade Register upon white paper, face east to ingest it, knock the teeth nine times, and softly intone:

*"Inheriting the primordial and numinous,
Upholding the ancient law of the void,
Bone and form align with the chart,
Jade Register and Golden Script,
The River’s Controller binds the self,
The Five Spirits radiate in splendor,
The Second Primordial rejoices,
The Mysterious Law descends to the chamber.
Inscribed in the Upper Clarity’s records,
One shall ride the flying chariot,
Eternally enjoying boundless fortune,
With blessings in abundance."*

Upon completion, the practice shall be observed for nine years, after which one’s name shall be inscribed in the Upper Clarity’s Golden Script and Jade Register, naturally attaining the ability to traverse the skies to its palace.

Upon completion, swallow qi eight times, bow eight times toward the east, and pay homage to the Eight August Deities of the Upper Clarity’s palace. Cease.

After nine years of this practice, the Upper Clarity shall inscribe one’s name in the Jade Register, and a vermilion cloud chariot shall descend to carry one upward to the Jade Clarity’s palace.

The August Highest Emperor Lord declares: Those who wish to inscribe their names upon the White Tablet of the Supreme Ultimate with azure script, and to ascend in flight to the Supreme Ultimate’s palace, shall on the third day of the third month write in azure ink the ten sounds of the White Tablet’s azure script, face the *chen* direction to ingest it, knock the teeth twelve times, and softly intone:

*"The Three Harmonies form a covenant,
The Mysterious Net encompasses the celestial stems,
The Five Bodies align with the chart,
The Mysterious Tablet’s azure script,
One’s name inscribed in the Supreme Ultimate,
Rank corresponding to the Upper Immortals,
The Three Primordials now arrayed,
The Six Qi spread forth,
Golden tones and jade characters,
I awaken to spontaneity,
Able to ride the flying radiance,
To ascend and reach the Emperor’s Dawn."*

Upon completion, swallow qi ten times, bow four times toward *chen*, and pay homage to the Four Perfected of the Supreme Ultimate. Cease.

After nine years of this practice, the Supreme Ultimate shall inscribe one’s name, the Four Perfected shall descend, bestow upon the practitioner the true script, and naturally awaken to the luminous tones, ascending in flight to the Upper Clarity.

The August Highest Emperor Lord declares: Those who wish to inscribe their names upon the Square Reservoir’s Mysterious Simplicity’s Purple Name, and to soar in flight to the Eastern Florescence’s palace, shall on the fourth day of the fourth month write in plain script the ten sounds of the Mysterious Simplicity’s Purple Name, face the *si* direction to ingest it, knock the teeth nine times, and softly intone:

*"The Nine Mysteries scatter numinosity,
The Seven Sages assist in praise,
The Eight Ways radiate brilliance,
Flowing essence gleams resplendent,
The Celestial Primordial spreads its net,
The Mysterious Chart awakens its rhyme,
One’s name inscribed in the Square Reservoir,
Ascending in flight to the Mysterious Han."*

Upon completion, swallow qi nine times, bow nine times toward *si*, and pay homage to the Great Deities of the Square Reservoir’s Azure Palace. Cease.

After nine years of this practice, the Square Reservoir shall inscribe one’s name, the Perfected shall descend, bestow the true script, and awaken insight and wisdom, enabling foresight of the unseen. One shall ride the void in flight, ascending to the Azure Palace.

The August Highest Emperor Lord declares: Those who wish to inscribe their names upon the Great Clarity’s Jade Register with crimson name and hidden script, and to soar within the Great Clarity’s midst, shall on the fifth day of the fifth month write in vermilion ink the ten sounds of the Jade Register’s crimson name, face south to ingest it, knock the teeth eight times, and softly intone:

*"Departing to establish the Mysterious Net,
Dividing positions among the Nine Palaces,
Dispersing the Primordial and scattering numinosity,
Overseeing the Eight Directions,
The Jade Register’s hidden script,
The Mysterious Chart’s vast emptiness,
The Emperor’s honor bends in reflection,
My rank as Immortal King,
Able to ride the flying radiance,
To ascend to the Purple Chamber,
Eternally preserving Heaven and Earth,
With the sun and moon sharing equal splendor."*

Upon completion, swallow qi nine times, bow twice toward the south, and pay homage to the Supreme Primordial Lady of the Southern Culmen.

After nine years of this practice, the Great Clarity shall inscribe the Jade Register with the crimson name, the nine apertures shall become thoroughly permeable, enabling perception of the hidden and obscure. The Perfected shall descend and commune with the spirit.

The August Highest Emperor Lord declares: Those who wish to inscribe their names upon the Supreme Simplicity’s Jade Tablet with golden name, and to ascend in flight to the Supreme Simplicity’s Upper Palace, shall on the sixth day of the sixth month write in yellow ink the ten sounds of the Jade Tablet’s golden name, face the *wei* direction to ingest it, knock the teeth eight times, and softly intone:

*"Simplicity’s numinosity gleams resplendent,
The Four Perfected spread their essence,
The Mysterious Chart’s jade script,
Golden characters and purple name,
Inscribed in the Supreme Simplicity’s register,
The Four Convergences thoroughly engender,
The Three Primordials exchange blessings,
I receive the Supreme Perfected,
Able to ride the Eight Radiances,
Vermilion shafts and green canopies,
Carefree and unbounded,
Ascending to create the Great Clarity."*

Upon completion, swallow qi eight times, bow eight times toward *wei*, and pay homage to the Supreme Simplicity. Cease.

After nine years of this practice, one’s name shall be inscribed upon the Jade Tablet, and one shall receive the script for flying in flight, riding the void to ascend to the Supreme Simplicity’s palace.

The August Highest Emperor Lord declares: Those who wish to inscribe their names upon the Southern Culmen’s Vermilion Script and Purple Register, and to ascend in flight to the Southern Culmen’s Upper Palace, shall on the seventh day of the seventh month write in vermilion ink the ten sounds of the Purple Register, face the *shen* direction to ingest it, knock the teeth three times, and softly intone:

*"Vermilion script binds the register,
The Purple Primordial’s mysterious script,
Flowering light intermingles and scatters,
The Upper Perfected spread their clouds,
Dispersing radiance bends in reflection,
My Dao alone divides,
Emerald plumes and flying script,
Vermilion brocade and green skirts,
Riding the radiant void in flight,
Entering the grotto’s gate,
Accompanying the Nine Elders of Ying,
The Eight Perfected in equal assembly."*

Upon completion, swallow qi eight times, bow eight times toward *shen*, and pay homage to the Eight August Supreme Perfected of the Southern Culmen’s Supreme Primordial. Cease.

After nine years of this practice, the Southern Culmen shall inscribe the Vermilion Script and Purple Register, the Three Primordials shall descend, bestow the true tones, and one shall ride the void in flight, ascending to the Southern Culmen’s palace.

The August Highest Emperor Lord declares: Those who wish to inscribe their names upon the Mysterious Palace’s Supreme Primordial’s Azure Gold and Vermilion Script with hidden text, and to ascend in flight above the Mysterious Palace, shall on the eighth day of the eighth month write in azure ink the ten sounds of the Azure Gold and Vermilion Script, face west to ingest it, knock the teeth nine times, and softly intone:

*"Heaven revolves and qi spreads,
The Four Nets align the directions,
The Three and Five intertwine,
The Nine Ways form clusters,
Azure gold and vermilion script,
Script illuminating the vast emptiness,
The Mysterious Chart rides the tones,
Eightfold reach and fourfold thoroughfare,
Thoroughly perceiving the subtle and obscure,
Resplendently beholding the boundless,
Able to pay homage to the Three Primordials,
Advancing to ascend the Purple Chamber,
Entering and exiting the Three Clarities,
Eternally preserving the flowering radiance."*

Upon completion, swallow qi six times, bow six times toward the west, and pay homage to the Upper Perfected of the Mysterious Palace. Cease.

After nine years of this practice, the Supreme Primordial shall inscribe the Azure Gold and Vermilion Script with hidden text, naturally awakening to profound comprehension, communing with the spirits, riding the void in flight, and ascending to the Upper Clarity.

The August Highest Emperor Lord declares: Those who wish to inscribe their names upon the Mysterious Capital’s Vermilion Terrace and White Jade with golden characters, and to ascend in flight above the Mysterious Capital, shall on the ninth day of the ninth month write in yellow ink the ten sounds of the White Jade’s golden characters, face the *xu* direction to ingest it, knock the teeth three times, and softly intone:

*"Heaven’s Dao follows its revolution,
The Mysterious Dipper circulates its essence,
The Three Primordials respond to the mechanism,
Converging and awakening numinosity,
The Mysterious Chart’s hidden register,
The Vermilion Terrace’s golden name,
White jade towering,
My Dao now luminous,
Eight convergences and four thoroughfares,
Above and below thoroughly clarified,
Spiritual qi descends,
The Six Palaces bind numinosity,
Able to ride the flying clouds,
Vermilion shafts and purple canopies,
Accompanying the Four Perfected in covenant,
Ascending to create the Flourishing Azure."*

When finished, swallow the qi nine times and cease, face the *xu* direction to bow twice, and pay homage to the Most High True Emperor of the Mysterious Capital. Cease.

By practicing this for nine years, the Mysterious Capital shall inscribe your name upon the Vermilion Terrace, and the Nine Elders shall descend to your chamber to bestow upon you the true scriptures. Spirits and humans shall converse with you, and you shall ascend to heaven in broad daylight.

The Most High Emperor Lord says: Those who wish to inscribe their name upon the Jade Tablets of the Three Primordials’ Palace in hidden green script, and ascend to fly in the Palace of the Three Primordials, shall on the tenth day of the tenth month write in green ink the ten sounds of the Jade Tablets’ hidden green script, face the northwest to ingest it, knock the teeth three times, and softly intone:

*"The nine qi amass numinosity,
The Three Ways revolve in cycles,
The August Supreme establishes its position,
The Mysterious Chart responds to the tally,
The Seven Sages of the Curved Jade observe my form,
My name is inscribed on the Jade Tablets,
My rank accords with the Mysterious Province,
Holding the reins, I ascend alone,
Arriving at the Cloud Thoroughfare,
The Three Mornings align in radiance,
The Eight Perfected form my retinue,
Preserving harmony with heaven,
Eternally without end."*

When finished, swallow the qi three times, face the northwest to bow thrice, and pay homage to the Three Primordials. Cease.

By practicing this for nine years, the Three Primordials shall inscribe your name upon the Jade Tablets, and the Perfected shall descend to your chamber to bestow upon you the true scriptures. They shall examine the subtle and obscure, and you shall fly through the Cloud Palace.

The Most High Emperor Lord says: Those who wish to inscribe their name within the Mysterious Dipper’s register of hidden names, and fly to the Upper Palace, shall on the eleventh day of the eleventh month write in black ink the ten sounds of the Mysterious Name Register, face due north to ingest it, knock the teeth twelve times, and softly intone:

*"The Mysterious Dipper circulates qi,
Revolving the net and ordering the stars,
The eight qi respond to numinosity,
The Mysterious Chart records the immortals,
My name is inscribed on the Jade Tablet,
Accordant with the Heavenly Perfected,
Within the Dipper’s canopy,
The Seven Primordials’ great spirits,
Bestow upon me the wondrous Dao,
Awakening my spontaneity,
Enabling me to soar and ascend,
To the Morning of the Emperor."*

When finished, swallow the qi seven times, face due north to bow seven times, and pay homage to the Seven Perfected within the Dipper. Cease.

By practicing this Dao for nine years, the Seven Perfected shall inscribe your name in the Mysterious Dipper’s register, and the Perfected shall descend to bestow upon you the true scriptures. Naturally penetrating and thorough, you shall comprehend spontaneity, ride the void to fly, and ascend to the Dipper’s Morning.

The Most High Emperor Lord says: Those who wish to inscribe their name upon the Five Peaks’ Vermilion Jade Tablet as the Purple Record of the Jade Tablets, to practice the method of flying through the Five Peaks, shall on the twelfth day of the twelfth month write in green ink the ten sounds of the Jade Tablets’ Purple Record, face the northeast to ingest it, knock the teeth three times, and softly intone:

*"The Five Peaks’ Vermilion Chambers,
Revered by the host of immortals,
The Emperor’s numinosity inscribes the script,
The Cloud Antiquity’s August Supreme,
The Mysterious Chart’s purple name,
Records the Five Palaces,
I receive spontaneity,
The radiance of the Great Void,
Ingesting the numinous sounds,
Penetrating the eight directions,
Feasting above in the Mysterious Capital,
Exiting being and entering non-being,
Roaming the Supreme Ultimate,
Without end or limit,
The Five Peaks’ Upper Perfected,
Form my fellowship,
Descending flying rosy clouds,
Ascending to the Emperor’s Chambers."*

When finished, swallow the qi five times and cease, face the northeast to bow five times, and pay homage to the Five Thearchs’ Numinous Lords. Cease.

By practicing this for nine years, the Five Thearchs shall inscribe your name upon the Five Peaks’ Jade Tablets and Purple Record. The Five Peaks’ immortal officials shall attend and guard your body, descending flying chariots to transport you, enabling your body to wander and feast in the Five Peaks’ Palaces.

Above are the methods of the Most High for inscribing names upon the Mysterious Chart, ingesting the numinous sounds, and naturally ascending.

Later students who practice this Dao shall have their names inscribed in the Upper Clarity, their jade tablets carved in the Flourishing Palace. The Five Thearchs shall support and protect them, and immortal officials shall respectfully welcome them. Their bodies shall emit purple qi, and a halo shall encircle their heads, illuminating even the obscure. Seated, they shall perceive spontaneity. After nine years, the numinous shall descend, and the Three Primordials shall visit their chambers. A numinous chariot with feathered canopy shall welcome their bodies to fly through the Mysterious Void, their rank elevated in the Immortal Realm.

If kept secret, the numinous shall descend; if divulged, the body shall perish. Practicing falsely or without sincerity shall implicate the seven ancestors in punishment, never to be absolved. The practitioner’s own life shall be forfeit, and they shall never again attain immortality.

Those of aspiration must guard this text with utmost secrecy.

The Most High Emperor Lord says: Later students who diligently cultivate, embodying benevolence and harmony, magnanimity and softness, whose demeanor is vast and whose conduct is accommodating, shall have their names inscribed in the Emperor’s register, their purple characters bound in the jade chapters. Their primordial qi shall be received and awakened in the Spirit Chart, their virtue and power manifesting in union with the immortals. Internally, they shall resonate with the Supreme Ultimate’s illumination; externally, they shall encompass the Great Artisan’s lineage. When their merit is complete and their Dao perfected, they shall naturally ascend to heaven in broad daylight.

The Most High Emperor Lord says: Among later students, some may appear refined yet yearn for immortality, diligent in the morning yet lax by evening, desiring inner ascent while clinging to external glory and profit. Some may maintain a disciplined form yet harbor a dissolute mind, or be diligent in heart yet careless in speech. Some may lack broad learning, attacking their teachers and sects, critiquing the myriad things, slandering the worthy and envying the sagely. They may favor some while resenting others, oppressing the weak and flattering the strong. Some may indulge in wine and lust, dissipating their spirit and losing their essence. Some may encounter scriptures without taking vows, secretly reading hidden texts, carelessly revealing numinous secrets to the unworthy, or transmitting without proper authorization, failing to pledge to the Five Peaks. All such acts constitute divulgence, incurring the punishment of the Four Luminaries.

Such individuals may bear the semblance of immortals, their names inscribed in the Emperor’s chapters, yet their conduct deviates from the root. They shall incur punishment and retribution, implicating their seven ancestors. Their bodies shall be destroyed, and they shall forever lose the Dao of immortality, eternally consigned to ghostly servitude, cycling through the Five Sufferings. What words can express their sorrow?

The Most High’s Prohibitions on the Seven Injuries to Immortality

For those students whose names are recorded in the Mysterious Register and whose bodies bear the signs of immortality, naturally aligning with the Perfected, yet whose hearts lack steadfast integrity, the Seven Injuries shall afflict them.

The First Injury: Cloaking truth with falsehood, indulging in lust and dissipating the spirit, depleting fluids and leaking essence, drying the radiance of vitality, scattering qi and dispersing the po, hollowing the bones and wasting the form. The spirit weeps in the exhausted palaces, ascending to the Heavenly Pass. The true immortals shall journey far away, while demonic spirits shall approach to harass. The self shall be consigned to the dark yin, the name erased from the Mysterious Register. Causes shall be bound in the Nine Prisons, and the Six Heavens shall become kin. Endlessly mired in suffering, how can one ever attain immortality?

The Second Injury: Outwardly appearing to follow the Dao, superficially embracing the truth, yet harboring a heart of dark malice, inherently cruel and wicked. Desiring others’ failure, envying the capable and resenting the worthy. Speaking sweetly while harboring deceit, appearing joyful while seething within. Critiquing gains and losses, delighting in sowing the seeds of transgression. Slandering and spying on fellow students, attacking the roots of their sects. Recorded by the Three Offices, they shall be marked as gates of evil. The immortals shall abandon them, and malevolent ghosts shall possess their bodies, compelling them to act as shadows and fly as demons. Thus, they shall suffer unjust calamities, their evil karma reaching its extreme. When their punishment is complete, their forms shall perish, and their souls shall sink into the Nine Springs. Though their names may be recorded in the Mysterious Register, how can they preserve their spontaneity?

The Third Harm: Indulging in wine and craving drunkenness, damaging qi and losing one’s spirit. The Five Palaces fall into chaos, the myriad spirits tremble in shock. Hun and po scatter and flee, inner and outer decay their numinous essence. The original chamber grows desolate, the Red Child wails in sorrow. The perfected immortals ascend far away, demonic spirits enter the body. Though such a one may accumulate sincerity, though their name be recorded in the Mysterious Register, they shall ultimately lose their jade name. Their spirit shall be confined to the Six Palaces, their body reduced to ashes in the dark underworld. Seeking longevity thus, how can their years endure?

The Fourth Harm: Conduct lacking in magnanimity and purity, demanding reverence from others while harboring resentment in the heart and curses on the tongue, delighting in contention. Joy and anger lack restraint, the nature remains unsettled. Qi surges wildly, scattering the inner perfected. Po departs, hun wanders, inviting calamity and illness. Years and lifespan decline and perish, all due to one’s nature. The perfected immortals ascend on high, while manifold afflictions assail the body. Though one may study diligently, this misfortune cannot be avoided. The hope of immortality grows ever more distant, while the days in hell lengthen.

The Fifth Harm: Having one’s name appear in the Mysterious Charts and receiving precious scriptures, or encountering a numinous master who imparts divine texts—yet failing to follow the precepts and covenants, revealing Heaven’s true essence. Before nine years have passed, one submits petitions to famous mountains, causing the Azure Palace to record their name and the Golden Watchtower to compile their deeds. Then, transmitting these teachings to others, scattering them among the world, treating the true lightly and leaking the precious. The consequences of this transgression shall bind one’s own body. Though their name may be recorded in the Mysterious Register, it shall instead burden the Seven Mysteries. The immortal Dao ascends on high, while their body dies and sinks into the dark springs, forever bearing ghostly retribution, never to be absolved for ten thousand kalpas.

The Sixth Harm: The body treading in filth and impurity, form and shadow lacking fragrance. Within, there is no purity and emptiness; without, no orchid-like fragrance. The Dao does not descend the true, the spirits do not dwell in their chambers. Qi is disturbed, essence is turbid, the numinous origin loses its radiance. The Five Spirits advance and scatter, the Red Child flees. Demonic evil attacks, bringing calamity within and without. Pursuing the Dao thus, seeking benefit only brings harm. The perfected immortals ascend far away, leaving only the corpse to wander alone. Sinking into irredeemable ruin, how can immortality be achieved?

The Seventh Harm: Consuming flesh that contains blood, slaughtering creatures to satisfy the mouth. Foul stench fills the viscera, harming life and injuring others. True qi is disturbed at the numinous gate, the wandering hun startles the Red Child. Hun and po depart from their palaces, filth and turbidity cling to the mouth and teeth. The perfected immortals abandon them in the clouds, while their own body sinks and stagnates in the earth. Though their name may be recorded in the Emperor’s jade registers, they shall ultimately not escape the death of the form.

The Most High Sage Emperor says: The foundation of learning lies in urgently guarding against the Seven Harms. Having gained the opportunity to gaze upon the gates of the Grotto-Heavens and peruse the jade scriptures, if one does not violate the prohibitions of the Seven Harms, one may sit and await the descent of the numinous, ascending at dawn on a white sun.

If, however, one diligently studies outwardly yet inwardly violates the Seven Harms, this shall lead to seeking immortality but instead meeting defeat, hoping for life but instead facing death, desiring fortune but instead encountering misfortune, aspiring to flight but instead sinking. The numinous immortals wander in the highest purity, while the Five Spirits scatter to the eight wilds. The Red Child wails and weeps in the central chamber, the wandering hun laments in the dark emptiness.

Thus, the signs of immortality may succeed or fail, and in the highest learning, there are the Seven Harms. Those who earnestly esteem the Dao must thoroughly refine their true essence.

The Most High Sage Emperor says: Those with jade bones and cinnabar script, whose names are listed in the Emperor’s charts, may behold the *Mysterious Register of the Seven Sages*. Those with golden marrow and purple treasuries, whose names are inscribed on golden tablets, may behold the hidden texts and inner scriptures. Those with extraordinary and wondrous features, purple wombs and jade networks, whose names are marked in the *Highest Clarity*, may behold the *White Tablet Jade Scriptures*. Those whose flowing essence emits purple radiance, whose inner and outer being is numinous, whose precious treasuries hold golden countenances, whose names are inscribed in the *Jade Void*, may behold the texts of the *Azure Register*. Those who are divinely outstanding and respond to the realm, with jade embryos and purple voids, whose names are inscribed in the *Eastern Florescence*, may behold the *Examination Text of the Seven Harms*.

Without such outstanding qualities, the numinous scriptures must not be rashly perused, nor the precious texts casually viewed. Those who behold these texts possess a mysterious essence that harmonizes with immortality. After nine years of cultivation, they shall attain flight through the dark void, ascending to the *Jade Clarity*.

When receiving the *Mysterious Register of the Seven Sages*, the *Nine Skies White Tablet*, or the *Azure Register*, master and disciple shall face each other in purification for ninety days, or thirty days. The disciple shall present seven taels of gold, seventy bolts of purple silk, and seven taels of cinnabar, approaching the master facing north to report their destiny to the Most High Sage. They shall transmit the texts after swearing an oath to Heaven.

If the master transmits without an oath, lightly leaking the precious texts, or if the disciple receives them without faith, recklessly perusing the jade scriptures, both shall suffer the judgment of the wind-blade, their seven ancestors burdened with retribution. They shall endure the Three Paths and Five Sufferings, never to be absolved for ten thousand kalpas. The divine soldiers of the Five Emperors shall constantly pursue those who leak the texts. Be clear and cautious in upholding these teachings.

Here ends the *Scripture of the Seven Sages’ Mysterious Register for Returning to the Nine Skies of Highest Clarity and Jade Emperor*.

chunks.original_text: 上清玉帝七圣玄纪回天九霄经 经名：上清玉帝七圣玄纪回天九霄经。 简称《七圣玄纪》。 撰人不详，约出於东晋。 系早期上清派重要经典。 一卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》正一部。 上清玉帝七圣玄纪回天九霄经 玉帝七圣玄纪回天九霄上经，乃上圣帝君以九玄建炁之始，空灵分判，二仪既彰，九元合韵，九帝命灵，齐景霄馆。 於是上圣携契玉虚紫宾，回骈丹霄琼轮，上登九层七映朱宫，徘徊明霞之上，萧条九空之中，天元冥滞，三景合光，流精曜虚，八会四通，交真齐契，啸咏太无，玄始映朗，天景敷陈，河海静波，八风扬轮，流烟蔚於龙轩，浮景扬於九玄，金仙秉钺，四司杖幡，五帝灵官十亿万人，飞麟羽骑备卫天真。 西华玉女、金晨灵童，曜云姿於琼侧，含仙容於兰房，散灵香以却秽，扬华精於拂尘。 游龙交驰於紫馆，毒兽奋爪於玉关，金翅抚翮於琼林，灵鹤飞吟於云端。 西妃击节，天女罗铮，龙吟虎啸，鸾舞凤呜，四真合唱，八音齐声，云璈激朗，倾骇三清，飞歌玄奏，广乐虚廷，流芬翳霞，灵风散真，华光交焕，三烛合明。 是时高圣太上大道君，佩九色离罗之帔，衣飞森霜珠之袍，巾须臾百变之冠，带晨光日铃育延之剑，豁落交带玉玺凤章，流金耀虚，七精激无，乘碧霞九灵八景流云之舆，从飞仙羽盖桑林千真、紫虚之童三十万人，显盖九霞，回天倾光，天丁前驱，六师厉锋，奔电扬精，四明扶灵启路，五老通津，飞旌琼途，流盻高清，上诣九层七映朱宫。 道君列座，九帝齐欢，三真合韵，七圣同欣，天音朗畅，高圣欢焉，玄心充於帝简，飞翰蔚乎庆烟，衅衅神灵，德虚体玄，曜龙文於沧渊，焕彩云於九天，濯高貌於兰玉，发金精於琼泉，列七纪於上录，明刻书於隐篇，括致沈毫，运转滞轮，采结五象，携集上真，寔高上之垂化，以敷教于群方也。 於是七圣撰上玄之章，集为灵文，命龟母按笔，太一拂筵，天妃侍香，玉华执巾，丹书紫字刻於白银，隐起灵韵结於玉篇，题以青录得道之名，以付五老上真仙都左公，藏於紫蕊玉笈，封以启命之章，玉童玉女各三百人，散花侍灵，七圣各掌一通，西龟定录，东华校名，请以五岳群仙。 后学之人，有奏简三元，奉录青宫，一年七拣，列名上清者，皆刻注於玄图，得为太平之上真。 此乃天诚玄畅於上圣，明德一合於三元。 故太上告命，记乎玉文，玄契冥唱，霄晖内鲜，洞玄悠韵，轮运应玄，高范超於三界，丹景陵於上真，克得题於白简，结录字於青文，冥图高妙，非以简札翰墨所能言宣，粗记千分之一，略标得真之遐迹尔。 回天九霄白简青录，上圣帝君受於九空，结飞玄紫炁自然之字，玄记后学得道之名，灵音韵合，玉朗禀真，或以字体，或以隐音，上下四会，皆表玄名空生，刻书广灵之堂。 旧文有十万玉言，字无正类，韵无正音，自非上圣莫能意通。 积七千年后，题昆仑之室北洞之源。 字方一丈，文蔚焕烂，四合垂芒，虚生庵蔼，若存若亡，流光紫炁拂其秽，金精冷炼莹其文，遂经累劫，字体鲜明。 至中皇元年九月七日，七圣齐灵，清斋长宫，金青盟天，誓告虔，奉受灵文。 高上解其曲滞，七圣通其妙音，记为回天九霄得道之篇，刻以白银之简，结以飞青之文，藏於云锦之囊，封以启命之章，付於五老仙都左公，掌录琼宫。

**The Supreme Clarity Jade Emperor’s Seven Sages Mysterious Record of the Nine Heavens’ Return to Heaven Scripture**

**Scripture Title:** *The Supreme Clarity Jade Emperor’s Seven Sages Mysterious Record of the Nine Heavens’ Return to Heaven Scripture* (abbreviated as *The Seven Sages Mysterious Record*).
Author unknown, approximately composed during the Eastern Jin dynasty. A foundational scripture of the early Supreme Clarity tradition. One fascicle.
Base text from: *Daoist Canon of the Orthodox Unity Tradition*, Section Zheng Yi.

---

**The Supreme Clarity Jade Emperor’s Seven Sages Mysterious Record of the Nine Heavens’ Return to Heaven Upper Scripture**

This is the *Upper Scripture of the Jade Emperor’s Seven Sages Mysterious Record of the Nine Heavens’ Return to Heaven*, wherein the Supreme Sage Emperor Lord established the inception of the Nine Mysteries’ primordial *qi*. The Void and Numinous divided, the Two Modes became manifest, the Nine Origins harmonized in resonance, and the Nine Emperors commanded the spirits, all converging in the Radiant Rosy Palace of the Nine Heavens.

Thereupon, the Supreme Sage, in accord with the Jade Void and Purple Guest, returned to the Cinnabar Rosy Wheel of the Nine Heavens, ascending the Nine-Tiered, Sevenfold-Luminous Crimson Palace. They wandered above the Bright Clouds, traversing the desolate expanse of the Nine Voids. The Heavenly Origin lay in profound stillness; the Three Luminaries merged their radiance. Flowing essence illuminated the Void; the Eight Assemblies and Four Convergences intermingled in perfect union. They chanted and intoned the Great Nothingness, and the Mysterious Beginning shone forth in clarity. The celestial scenes unfolded in splendor; rivers and seas stilled their waves. The Eight Winds turned their wheels; drifting mists gathered at the Dragon’s Terrace. Floating light spread across the Nine Mysteries; Golden Immortals wielded their halberds, while the Four Directors bore their banners. The Five Thearchs’ spirit-officials, ten billion in number, soared on winged unicorns to guard the Heavenly Perfected.

The Western Florescence Jade Maidens and Golden Dawn Spirit Lads displayed their cloud-like grace beside the jasper halls, their immortal countenances concealed within the orchid chambers. They scattered numinous incense to dispel impurities and raised refined essence with their dusters. Dragons coursed in pairs through the Purple Palace; venomous beasts brandished their claws at the Jade Gates. Golden-winged birds preened their feathers in the jasper groves; spirit cranes soared and sang amid the clouds.

The Western Consorts struck the rhythm; Heavenly Maidens arrayed their chimes. Dragons roared and tigers howled; phoenixes danced and simurghs sang. The Four Perfected harmonized their voices; the Eight Sounds rang in unison. Cloud zithers resounded brightly, startling the Three Clarities. Soaring songs and mysterious melodies filled the vast celestial court. Fragrance wafted through the misty clouds; numinous winds dispersed the true essence. Radiant light intertwined; the Three Candles merged their brilliance.

At this time, the Most High Supreme Lord of the Great Dao donned a robe of nine-colored parted silk, clad in a gown woven with frost-like pearls. His cap transformed in an instant; his sash bore the Morning Light Sun Bell and the Life-Extending Sword. The Falling and Interlacing Sash displayed the Jade Seal and Phoenix Insignia. Flowing gold illuminated the Void; the Seven Essences surged without bound. He rode the Ninefold Numinous, Eightfold Luminous, cloud-borne chariot of azure mist. Following him were three hundred thousand flying immortals beneath feathered canopies of the Mulberry Grove, along with the Purple Void Lads. Their canopies unfurled across the Nine Clouds, turning the heavens and inclining the light. Heavenly Soldiers led the way; the Six Masters brandished their blades. Lightning bolts flashed and essence flared; the Four Illuminations upheld the numinous path. The Five Elders opened the celestial ford; flying banners lined the jasper roads. Their gazes swept the lofty clarity as they ascended to the Nine-Tiered, Sevenfold-Luminous Crimson Palace.

The Dao Lord took his seat; the Nine Emperors rejoiced in unison. The Three Perfected harmonized their resonance; the Seven Sages shared in delight. Heavenly music rang clear; the Supreme Sage exulted. His mysterious heart filled the Emperor’s tablets; soaring brushstrokes flourished amid the celebratory mists. The spirits thrived in harmony; virtue and emptiness embodied the Mysterious. Dragon patterns gleamed upon the azure abyss; colorful clouds blazed across the Nine Heavens. His lofty visage was bathed in orchid and jade; golden essence emanated from the jasper springs. The Seven Records were inscribed in the Upper Register; the hidden chapters were etched with luminous script. They gathered and bound the submerged brushstrokes, turning the stagnant wheels, weaving together the Five Symbols, and assembling the Supreme Perfected. This was the lofty transmission of the Most High, spreading teachings to all directions.

Thereupon, the Seven Sages composed the chapters of the Supreme Mystery, compiling them into numinous texts. The Turtle Mother wielded the brush; the Great One swept the mat. Heavenly Consorts attended with incense; Jade Florescence held the towels. Cinnabar script in purple characters was engraved upon white silver, its hidden numinous resonance bound within the jade chapters. The names of those who attained the Dao were inscribed in green records and entrusted to the Five Elders, the Left Duke of the Immortal Capital. They were stored in the Purple Stamen Jade Case, sealed with the Seal of Command. Three hundred Jade Lads and Maidens each scattered flowers to attend the numinous. The Seven Sages each held a copy; the Western Turtle fixed the records, and the Eastern Florescence verified the names, summoning the immortals of the Five Peaks.

For later learners who present petitions to the Three Origins and offer records to the Azure Palace, undergoing seven selections in a year, those whose names are listed in the Supreme Clarity shall be inscribed upon the Mysterious Chart and become Perfected Ones of the Great Peace.

This is the celestial sincerity and mysterious harmony of the Supreme Sages, where luminous virtue unites with the Three Origins. Thus, the Most High issued his decree, recording it in jade script. The Mysterious Accord resounded in hidden song; the radiance of the heavens shone within. The profound and distant resonance of the Cavern Mystery turned in accord with the Mysterious. The lofty model transcended the Three Realms; the cinnabar light soared above the Supreme Perfected. Those who succeeded were inscribed upon the White Tablets and their names bound in the Green Records. The mysterious chart is lofty and wondrous, beyond the expression of brush and ink. This is but a rough sketch of one thousandth part, a brief outline of the distant traces of those who attained the true.

The *White Tablets and Green Records of the Nine Heavens’ Return to Heaven* were received by the Supreme Sage Emperor Lords from the Nine Voids. They bound the characters of the soaring mysterious purple *qi*, naturally formed, recording the names of later learners who attained the Dao. The numinous sounds harmonized in resonance; jade clarity upheld the true. Some were expressed in written form, others in hidden tones. The Four Convergences above and below all signified the empty birth of the mysterious names, inscribed within the Hall of Vast Numinosity.

The ancient text contained one hundred thousand jade words, their forms without fixed type, their rhymes without fixed sound. None but the Supreme Sages could fathom their meaning. After seven thousand years, they were inscribed within the northern cavern of the Kunlun Chambers. Each character measured a *zhang* in size; the text blazed with resplendent brilliance. The four directions emitted radiance; empty mists arose, now present, now absent. Flowing light and purple *qi* dispelled impurities; golden essence refined and polished the script. Through countless kalpas, the characters remained fresh and bright.

In the first year of the Middle August era, on the seventh day of the ninth month, the Seven Sages united their numinous powers. They purified themselves in the Long Palace, swearing oaths to the golden and azure heavens, pledging their reverence. They received the numinous text. The Most High resolved its obstructions; the Seven Sages comprehended its wondrous sounds. They recorded it as the *Scripture of the Nine Heavens’ Return to Heaven for Attaining the Dao*, inscribed upon white silver tablets, bound with soaring green script. It was stored in a cloud-brocade pouch, sealed with the Seal of Command, and entrusted to the Left Duke of the Five Elders’ Immortal Capital, to be safeguarded in the Jasper Palace.

chunks.original_text: 依四极明科，万劫一传，检以四司之律，罚以五帝神兵。 名参玄简，当得此文。 得者轻泄，殃灭九族，考累七玄，己身亡命，长责鬼官，虽有玄名，不得入仙。 七圣玄纪回天上文，或以韵合，或支类相参，或上下四会以成字音，或标其正讳，或单复相兼，皆出玄古洞之中，高圣撰集以明灵文。 后学之士，名参其篇，得受宝诀，自然上仙。 然有六合，复有七伤，宝之则合，忽之则亡，有分之身，勤加精诚，长斋灵阜，远寻幽山，烧香行礼，晨夕诵经，弃诸杂想，心注太真，克得玄降，白日飞腾。 凡后学之士，或名不书玄简，而备得宝经者，皆以己身有宿世重德，丰柯垂荫，度逮其身，或身有冥功，志分出群，单心苦尚，上感玉皇，四极所奏，五岳记名，致遇经师，得受宝文。 如使精勤，不犯七伤，则使真人下降，授其真文，注上玄纪，亦七年成仙也。 诸得见上圣玄纪之文者，皆以玄名有飞仙之分，刻书於来生之象，逆注玄虚之篇，既禀人道，青宫拣名，四司所保，五帝所诠，玉虚结藏，紫络植根，骨有奇光，举形合仙，四司潜降，阴受宝文，太一定籍，司命与年，魂固魄安，六胃结真，万神总具，克成上仙。 修行七年，自当灵降，乘空飞腾。 高圣帝君曰：凡得七圣玄纪回天九霄，虽未升腾，皆青宫拣名，告下五岳，付诸灵山河海司官，防卫其身，玉童玉女各十二人，侍卫灵文，奉经行真。 此玄挺应会，理会自然，上圣皆以逆注真录，位准仙卿，须以道备，四真诣房，降下云舆，令白日登晨，俯仰之格，随品进仙。 此道遐眇，非以常学所可窥闻，奉者宝秘，慎勿妄宣。 高圣六合隐存定简记仙上法 高圣帝君曰：正月一日、三月三日、五月五日、七月七日、九月九日、十一月十一日，此一年六日，是天德值合之时。 七圣定简，五帝记名，西龟勒录，东华结篇。 当此之日，天元合庆，四司罗兵，高上显盖，玉虚回骈，九帝束带，七圣齐灵，亿真万仙，皆浮位金庭，三晨翼轩，七元焕明，天地洁落，十界肃清。 九天帝王遣监真使者，高上七圣遣定录左仙，西龟王母命五老仙伯西皓中真，东华青童遣领仙玉郎，各部飞仙游轮羽骑，周行十天五岳名山，阴察洞元已得道者游散仙官，及后学之人名参简录，身未升腾，或玄纪无名，而苦行修勤，情冠玉虚，上感玉皇。 诸以学身，当此之日，清斋烧香，弃诸异想，愿合天心，存思苦念，修行灵文，为五帝所举，即勒注白简，素录记名，即遣四极下降，授以上真，七年，当得乘空驾虚，上登霄晨。 当此之日，如有轻慢天宝，漏泄玄文，身犯七伤，为四司所纠，有白简之名者，皆勒落青录，注还鬼官。 宿无简记，因缘遇经，即命五帝罚以神兵，收捕七祖，充责河源死生之考，如日之明。 故学在精心，不必於白简玄名也。 唯密唯苦，便获神仙。 高圣玉帝道君曰：欲书白简玄纪之名，身登玉清上宫之法，当以正月一日上合之时，沐浴清斋，平旦入室烧香，北向九拜，朝礼玉帝毕，北向平坐，叩齿九通，思斋室之内有青云蓊郁，周匝一室。 存五老仙伯在青云之中，披飞青羽帔，冠通天玉冠，手执青文之录。 思领仙玉郎着云锦之袍，冠七宝玉冠，手执白银之简。

Pursuant to the *Luminous Statutes of the Four Poles*, this scripture is transmitted but once in ten thousand kalpas. It is examined by the laws of the Four Offices and enforced by the divine soldiers of the Five Emperors. Only those whose names are inscribed upon the Mystic Register may receive this text. Should any recipient recklessly divulge it, calamity shall annihilate nine generations; their sevenfold spirit shall endure eternal torment, their own life forfeit, and they shall be bound in long servitude to the ghostly officials. Though their name may be recorded in the Mystic Register, they shall never ascend as immortals.

The *Mystic Chronicle of the Seven Sages’ Return to Heaven* is composed in verses that harmonize, its branches and categories interwoven, its characters formed through the convergence of upper and lower elements, or marked by their proper taboo names. Some are single, some compound, all emerging from the primordial caverns of the Mystic Antiquity, compiled by the Most High Sages to elucidate the numinous script. Later scholars whose names are inscribed within its chapters and who receive its precious instructions shall naturally ascend as immortals.

Yet there are the Six Harmonies and the Seven Harms: treasure this text, and they align; neglect it, and they vanish. Those destined for this path must exert utmost sincerity, observe prolonged fasts upon sacred mounds, seek out secluded mountains, burn incense and perform rites, recite the scripture morning and evening, cast aside all distracting thoughts, and fix their minds upon the Supreme Perfection. Only then may they attain the descent of the Mystic, ascending in broad daylight to soar through the heavens.

Among later scholars, some whose names are not inscribed upon the Mystic Register yet obtain the precious scripture—these possess profound virtue from past lives, their boughs casting shade upon their descendants, or they have accrued hidden merit, their aspirations surpassing the multitude. With single-minded devotion and arduous practice, they move the Jade Emperor; the Four Poles bear witness, the Five Peaks record their names, and they encounter a master who bestows the precious text. Should they practice with diligence and avoid the Seven Harms, a Perfected One shall descend to transmit the true scripture, inscribing their name in the Mystic Chronicle. In seven years, they too shall attain immortality.

All who behold the *Mystic Chronicle of the Most High Sages* possess names destined for immortal flight, their names engraved upon the image of their future lives, inscribed in reverse upon the scrolls of the Mystic Void. Having received the human Dao, their names are selected by the Azure Palace, protected by the Four Offices, expounded by the Five Emperors, concealed within the Jade Void, and rooted in the Purple Web. Their bones bear wondrous radiance, their entire form harmonizing with the immortal realm. The Four Offices descend in secret, bestowing the precious text in darkness. The Supreme Unity fixes their register; the Director of Destinies grants them years. Their souls are steadfast, their spirits at peace, their six viscera congealing the true, and the myriad spirits fully assembled—thus they attain the rank of Supreme Immortal. After seven years of cultivation, the numinous shall descend of itself, and they shall ride the void to ascend in flight.

The Most High Sage Emperor declares: All who receive the *Mystic Chronicle of the Seven Sages’ Return to the Nine Heavens*, though they have not yet ascended, shall have their names selected by the Azure Palace and reported to the Five Peaks, entrusted to the officials of the sacred mountains, rivers, and seas for their protection. Twelve Jade Lads and twelve Jade Maidens shall attend them, safeguarding the numinous script and serving the scripture in their practice of the true. This Mystic Destiny aligns with the natural order; the Most High Sages inscribe it in reverse upon the True Register, their positions commensurate with those of immortal ministers. When their Dao is complete, the Four Perfected shall visit their chambers, and a cloud chariot shall descend, enabling their ascent in broad daylight. The standards of ascent and the ranks of immortality shall be conferred according to their merit.

This Dao is profound and subtle, not to be glimpsed or heard through ordinary study. Those who receive it must treasure and conceal it; guard against reckless disclosure.

The Most High Sage Emperor declares: On the first day of the first month, the third day of the third month, the fifth day of the fifth month, the seventh day of the seventh month, the ninth day of the ninth month, and the eleventh day of the eleventh month—these six days of the year are the times when the Celestial Virtue aligns in harmony. The Four Offices array their soldiers, the Most High displays their canopy, the Jade Void revolves in paired ranks, the Nine Emperors gird their sashes, the Seven Sages unite their numinous powers, and the myriad Perfected Ones and ten thousand immortals all ascend to the Golden Court. On these days, those who study the Dao must purify themselves in fasting, burn incense, cast aside all distracting thoughts, align their wishes with the celestial will, concentrate their minds in earnest contemplation, and cultivate the numinous script. If the Five Emperors commend them, their names shall be inscribed upon the White Register and recorded in the Plain Record. The Four Poles shall then descend to bestow the Supreme Perfection, and in seven years, they shall ride the void and ascend to the dawn heavens.

On these days, should any treat the celestial treasure with disdain, leak the Mystic Script, or incur the Seven Harms, they shall be seized by the Four Offices. Those whose names are inscribed upon the White Register shall have their names struck from the Azure Record and reassigned to the ghostly officials. Those without prior inscription in the register who encounter the scripture by karmic affinity shall be punished by the Five Emperors with divine soldiers, their seven ancestors seized and condemned to the trials of the River Source’s life-and-death reckoning, as evident as the brightness of the sun.

Thus, cultivation depends on the sincerity of the heart, not merely upon having one’s name inscribed in the White Register or the Mystic Chronicle. Only through secrecy and arduous devotion may one attain immortality.

The Most High Jade Emperor Dao Lord declares: To inscribe one’s name in the White Register and the Mystic Chronicle and ascend to the Jade Clarity’s Upper Palace, one must, at the time of the first day of the first month’s celestial convergence, bathe and purify oneself in fasting. chunks.original_text: 乘空驾虚上九玄，自知玄记白简文， 其法密宝见者仙。 上圣紫清太素三元君列玄纪上篇曰 三五之末至道沈，门内有人名观音。 闭口不言历古今，空洞之中穴何深。 工非神匠带人心，单车失迪登山林。 冥木茂盛郁阳森，我有何求山下吟。 一土参玄据宫商，披褐咏经理灵衿。 白玉峨峨陵云岑，十斗历数力相寻。 呜齿召神合玉音，与月相望期上金。 皇上八真来相凭，白帝行炁道当新。 名书紫简得其篇，西龟定录位真人。 逆注玄纪应自然，慎勿妄泄道泯泯。 所谓法鼓会群神。 上圣白玉龟台九灵太真西王母列 玄纪上篇曰 玄古之上引弓长，立人在左专为强。 白简玄纪草飞翔，十口学道并无粮。 山下饵豆过十昌，三力同心君牧羊。 日月乘焉四体强，一士二刀齐四乡。 千子合真八来迎，北极女子头建巾。 与月结期生云英，龙飞之后道当行。 要须玄记补上宫，名参青录升西堂。 自得其诀乘空翔，遨游八极乐未央。 子有此文深秘藏，四极试观题诸方。 逆注玄简东华宫，不出七年约来从。 上圣中央黄老君列玄记上篇曰 上元有真一炁玄，守之者何月中人。 了不学他遇一贤，誓信奉受受要言。 迅辔九霄卒获真，朱玉含宝华光鲜。 绿草郁郁坐丹田，日精带中赤石边。 昌元之先升三天，金王木废选此人。 各自勤心寻道根，克见玄纪及灵篇。 得书白简青录文，四极下降授子真。 乘空飞行升九玄，轻传妄泄入幽泉。 长充鬼役不得仙。 上圣扶桑太帝君列玄纪上篇曰 紫虚玉馆乘素丝，唯有皇人心相期。 周之后氏田中儿，月照幽谷上高台。 历观八极见赤精，洞念幽微二人并。 俛仰寻真力手轻，得道宝诀首体生。 北有上真南方平，安在玄阙期高灵。 十子八实辅吾经，当须金后道治清。 学者勤念寻其名，克书玉简致紫軿。 三元诣房授真经，晓知玄纪升三清。 飞行玄虚登帝庭，深藏宝密克得仙。 妄泄轻传灭尔形，死充下鬼毕劫龄。 后圣金阙帝君列玄纪上篇曰 九一之字难可听，在阜之南易为名。 竟须九炼与金精，圆口之中光延明。 二日守元见真形，碧石落落人中生。 耳下带玉口咏经，绿草郁郁冬夏荣。 上素丝结三心并，皇老光光耀日庭。 高上真人叩玉琼，至於万劫乃成婴。 良木重森植秀龄，两舆羽合洒八冥。 六十玉女侍汝形，奎宿入吕辅刀兵。 赤儿出游六国平，四方之数万神灵。 刻书玉简补上清，壬辰之后道治明。 必有先智得此经，当为人宗简勤精。 十十五五结弟兄，登山告盟列华清。 得有此应注玄名，三元下降致绿軿。 弓口出治侍华庭，当此之时乐未央。

Riding the void, steering emptiness to ascend the Nine Mysteries,
One knows the mysterious records inscribed on white slips—
Their methods are secret treasures; those who behold them become immortals.

The Supreme Sage, the Purple Clarity, the Three Primordials of Great Simplicity,
in the *Upper Scroll of the Mysterious Record*, states:
At the end of the Three and Five, the Dao sank into obscurity,
Yet within the gate there was one named Guanyin.
Mouth sealed, silent through ancient and modern ages,
How deep is the cavern within the hollow vastness?
Craft not of divine artisanship bears the weight of human hearts;
A lone carriage, losing its way, ascends the mountain forests.
Dark trees flourish, lush with yang’s verdant shade—
What do I seek? Below the mountain, a chant arises.
One clod of earth joins the mysterious, grasping the notes of gong and shang,
Donning coarse robes, chanting scriptures, tending the numinous lapel.
White jade towers, towering above cloud-wreathed peaks,
Ten measures of destiny’s reckoning vie in strength.
Whistling through teeth to summon spirits, harmonizing with jade tones,
Gazing with the moon, they await the ascent to gold.
The August Emperor’s Eight Perfected arrive to rely upon,
The White Emperor circulates qi—our Dao is renewed.
Names inscribed on purple slips, attaining its scroll,
The Western Tortoise confirms the record—you are ranked among the Perfected.
Inverse annotations of the Mysterious Record align with nature;
Beware of reckless disclosure, lest the Dao dissolve into nothingness.
This is called the Dharma Drum, assembling the host of spirits.

The Supreme Sage, the White Jade Tortoise Terrace, the Nine Numinous Perfected,
the Grand Realized One of the West, the Queen Mother,
in the *Upper Scroll of the Mysterious Record*, states:
In the highest antiquity, bows were drawn long,
A man stood to the left, intent on strength alone.
White slips and mysterious records soar like grass in flight—
Ten mouths study the Dao, yet lack provisions.
Below the mountain, they feed on beans, surpassing ten flourishing years;
Three forces unite in heart—you, the shepherd.
Sun and moon ride forth, the four limbs grow strong,
One scholar, two blades, together in the four directions.
A thousand disciples unite in perfection; eight come to welcome,
A girl of the North Pole wears a kerchief upon her head.
Pledging with the moon, she gives birth to cloud blossoms;
After the dragon’s flight, the Dao shall prevail.
You must mend the Upper Palace with the Mysterious Record,
Your name inscribed in the Azure Register, ascending the Western Hall.
Having obtained its secret, you ride the void in flight,
Roaming the eight poles—joy unending.
If you possess this text, conceal it deeply;
Test it across the four extremes, inscribing it in all directions.
Inverse annotations of the Mysterious Slips in the Eastern Florescence Palace—
Within seven years, they shall come as promised.

The Supreme Sage, the Central Yellow Elder Lord,
in the *Upper Scroll of the Mysterious Record*, states:
In the Upper Primordial, there is the True One, the mysterious qi—
Who guards it? The moon’s own person.
Without learning others, one encounters a worthy,
Vowing faith, receiving and embracing its essential words.
Swiftly reining through the nine skies, one suddenly attains the real;
Cinnabar jade cradles treasures, their radiance fresh.
Green grasses flourish, seated in the cinnabar field,
The sun’s essence in the belt, beside the red stone.
Before the flourishing of the primordial, ascending the Three Heavens,
Metal and wood yield—this person is chosen.
Each diligently seeks the root of the Dao,
Striving to behold the Mysterious Record and the Numinous Scroll.
Having obtained the white slips and the Azure Register’s text,
The four extremes descend to confer upon you the real.
Riding the void in flight, ascending the Nine Mysteries,
Lightly transmitting or recklessly divulging leads to the dark springs.
Forever bound to ghostly servitude, one attains no immortality.

The Supreme Sage, the Great Thearch of Fusang,
in the *Upper Scroll of the Mysterious Record*, states:
The Purple Void’s Jade Pavilion, borne by plain silk,
Only the August One’s heart keeps the tryst.
After Zhou, in the fields, a child—
The moon illuminates the secluded valley, ascending the high terrace.
Surveying the eight poles, beholding the crimson essence,
Contemplating the subtle and profound, two stand as one.
Bowing and rising, seeking the real, the hands grow light;
Obtaining the Dao’s precious secret, the head and body quicken.
To the north, the Upper Perfected; to the south, peace—
Where do they abide? In the mysterious watchtower, awaiting the lofty numinous.
Ten disciples, eight fruits, assist our scripture;
When the Golden Monarch comes, the Dao’s governance is pure.
Scholars diligently contemplate, seeking its name,
Striving to inscribe jade slips, summoning purple chariots.
The Three Primordials visit the chamber to confer the true scripture;
At dawn, knowing the Mysterious Record, one ascends the Three Clarities.
Soaring through the mysterious void, ascending the Thearch’s court,
Deeply concealing the precious secret, one attains immortality.
Reckless disclosure or light transmission erases your form,
Dying, you fill the ranks of lower ghosts, completing the kalpa’s span.

The Later Sage, the Thearch of the Golden Watchtower,
in the *Upper Scroll of the Mysterious Record*, states:
The Nine-One’s script is hard to hear,
South of the mound, its name is easily known.
You must refine nine times with golden essence,
Within the round mouth, light extends and brightens.
Guarding the primordial for two days, beholding the true form,
Emerald stones fall, falling—born amid humanity.
Below the ears, jade hangs; the mouth chants scriptures,
Green grasses flourish, winter and summer in bloom.
Plain silk knots the three hearts as one,
The August Elder shines brilliantly in the sun’s court.
The Highest Perfected knock upon jade chimes,
Through ten thousand kalpas, they become infants.
Fine trees, dense and lush, plant long life,
Two chariots, feathered, sprinkle the eight darknesses.
Sixty jade maidens attend your form,
The Straddling Constellation enters Lü, aiding the blades of war.
The Crimson Child roams, the Six States at peace,
The reckoning of the four directions—ten thousand spirits.
Inscribing jade slips to mend the Upper Clarity,
After the ren-chen year, the Dao’s governance is bright.
There must be those of prior wisdom who obtain this scripture,
Destined to be humanity’s patriarchs, diligent in the slips.
Ten tens and five fives, binding brothers,
Ascending the mountain to pledge oaths, arrayed in the Florescence of Hua.
Having obtained this resonance, inscribe the mysterious name—
The Three Primordials descend, sending green chariots.
The bow-mouthed one emerges to govern, serving the Hua Court;
At this time, joy is unending.

chunks.original_text: 窥看，轻泄妄宣，七祖充责，登履刀山己身亡命，长谢河源，不得入仙。 高圣隐书金名玉字内文 高圣帝君曰：金阁有隐书玉名，有知者飞升金阙，腾景上清。 佩之者则金阁刻书，玉简注名，四渎五岳灵仙，营卫送迎。 九年得乘飞云，役使玉女十二人。 丹书白缯。 高圣帝君曰：上清金书玉录上文，有知者飞升上清，位齐四真。 佩之者则上清刻书，金简注名，神仙告下五岳，以仙官扶迎。 青书白缯。 高圣帝君曰：太极白简青文，有知者飞升太极宫，腾景金阙之中。 佩之者太极刻书於简文，注名於神仙，四极营卫，九年飞行。 青书白缯。 高圣帝君曰：方诸玄素紫名隐文，有知者飞升方诸宫，佩之者则方诸刻书玄素紫名，九年飞行，神仙卫迎，五岳记名。 青书白缯。 高圣帝君曰：太清玉籍绛名隐文，有知者飞行太清，腾景琼宫。 佩之者太清刻书绛名於玉籍，九年通神飞行，给玉童十二人。 丹书白缯。 高圣帝君曰：太素琼简金名隐文，有知者飞升太素之宫，上朝三元君。 得佩之者，太素刻书琼简，九年降致飞云，白日升天。 黄书白缯。 高圣帝君曰：南极有丹文紫录上文，有知者白日飞升，谒南极上元。 得佩之者，则南极注名於紫录，九年三元君下降，授子真书，白日升天。 丹书白缯。 高圣帝君曰：玄宫上元青金赤书隐文，有知者飞升云宫，腾景上清。 佩之者目见上元真形，九年降兆之房，授兆真书，即得神仙也。 青书白缯。 高圣帝君曰：玄都丹台白玉金字隐文，有知者白日飞升玄都。 佩之者刻书丹台之名，九年乘空景而行，久久神仙。 黄书白缯。 高圣帝君曰：三元宫琳札青书隐文，有知者白日升天，上拜三元君。 得佩之者，刻名於琼琳之札，九年三元诣房，授兆真文，神仙飞行。 青书白缯。 高圣帝君曰：玄斗之中玄名录籍隐文，知者得升玄斗之中，飞行上清之宫，刻书玄斗之名，九年神人下降，授兆真书，行之神仙。 黑书白缯。 高圣帝君曰：五岳有丹书琼简紫录之名，知者白日升天，飞行五岳，仙官防卫兆身，五帝刻名於五岳之简，九年乘空飞行，上升玄宫。 青书白缯。 诸隐文皆玄古空同之书，以表得道合仙之人。 有得见此文，皆四极所监，五帝所举，万灵侍卫，群真敬迎。 有知其音，飞行上清，三元下降，与兆同升。 得佩其文，刻书玄图，给玉童玉女各十二人，游行五岳，履涉名山，十界稽首，万仙来朝。 九年自当洞明其音，与神人交言，乘云步虚，飞行太空。 高圣隐存刻书琼文简录上法 高圣帝君曰：欲书名金阙玉录，飞行上清，当以正月一日，丹书金阙隐书玉名十音，向寅上服之，叩齿十二通，微祝曰： 天恢炁精，五晨络形，禀统玄古，金阙记名，上元合庆，天津敷荣，服御隐文，身飞玉清，洞晓自然，与帝合灵。 毕，咽炁九过，上九拜，朝金阙帝尊，便止。 行之九年，金阙书名，刻字玉篇，自然明解天书，与帝合并也。 高圣帝君曰：欲书名上清金书玉箓之文，飞行上清之宫者，当以二月二日，青书金简玉录十音白纸上，向东服之，叩齿九通，微祝曰： 胤元玄灵，承古法虚，骨象应图，玉录金书，河魁络己，五神焕舒，次庆二元，玄律降庐，名题上清，得乘飞舆，永享无穷，福庆有余。

The August Sage Lord declares: The Cinnabar Terrace of the Mysterious Capital holds the Hidden Writ of White Jade and Golden Characters. Uniting with the Upper Primordial’s jubilation,

Upholding the ancient law of the void,
Bone and form align with the chart,
Jade Register and Golden Script,
The River’s Controller binds the self,
The Five Spirits radiate in splendor,
The Second Primordial rejoices,
The Mysterious Law descends to the chamber.
Inscribed in the Upper Clarity’s records,
One shall ride the flying chariot,
Eternally enjoying boundless fortune,
With blessings in abundance."*

Upon completion, the practice shall be observed for nine years, after which one’s name shall be inscribed in the Upper Clarity’s Golden Script and Jade Register, naturally attaining the ability to traverse the skies to its palace.

chunks.original_text: 毕，咽炁九过止，向戌再拜，朝玄都上真帝尊，止。 行此九年，则玄都刻名於丹台，九老下降兆房，授兆真文，神人交言，白日升天。 高圣帝君曰：欲书名三元宫琳札青书隐文，飞升三元之宫者，当以十月十日，青书琳札青书十音，向西北而服之，叩齿三通，微祝曰： 九炁郁灵，三道回周，皇上置位，玄图应符，七圣曲瑛，已鉴我躯，名书琳札，位准玄州，控辔特升，上到云衢，三晨齐景，八真结俦，与天相保，永无终休。 毕，咽炁三过，向西北三拜，朝三元，止。 行此九年，则三元刻书琳札之名，下降兆房，授兆真文，审察幽微，飞行云宫。 高圣帝君曰：欲书名玄斗之中玄名录籍，飞行上宫者，当以十一月十一日，墨书玄名录籍十音，向正北服之，叩齿十二通，微祝曰： 玄斗运炁，回纲整辰，八炁应灵，玄图记仙，题名玉札，上合天真，斗中华盖，七元大神，降我妙道，启我自然，令我飞腾，上之帝晨。 毕，咽炁七过，向正北七拜，朝斗中七真，止。 行此道九年，七真刻书玄斗录籍，真人下降，授兆真文，自然洞达，晓知自然，乘空飞行，上升斗晨。 高圣帝君曰：欲书名五岳丹圭曰琼简紫录之名，飞行五岳之法，即当十二月十二日，青书琼简紫录十音，向东北服之，叩齿三通，微祝曰： 五岳丹房，群仙所宗，帝灵刻书，云古上皇，玄图紫名，定录五宫，我禀自然，法景太空，服御灵音，洞睹八方，上宴玄都，出有入无，逍遥太极，无终无穷，五岳上真，结我为朋，降致飞霞，升入帝房。 毕，咽炁五过止，向东北五拜，朝五帝灵尊，毕。 行此九年，则五帝刻书玄名，於五岳琼简紫录之文，五岳仙官侍卫兆身，降致飞与，运兆之身，游宴五岳之宫。 右高圣书名玄图，服御灵音自然上法。 后学得行此道，则有玄名於上清，刻玉简於华宫，五帝扶护，仙官敬迎，身发紫炁，项有圆光，洞映无幽，坐睹自然，九年灵降，三元诣房，灵舆羽盖，迎兆之身，飞行玄虚，位加仙乡。 密则灵降，泄则灭身，妄行不真，七祖充责，万劫不原，己身丧命，永无复仙。 有志之士，慎密此文。 高圣帝君曰：后学有好尚勤修，仁和行柔，色弘四大，触类有容，如此之人，皆玄名题於帝籍，紫字结於玉篇，纳元启於神图，德尚显於合仙，内则感太极鉴映，外则总大匠之宗，功满道备，则自然白日升天。 高圣帝君曰：后学之人，或有皮好而望仙，朝勤而暮怠，内希腾举，外重荣利。 或形谨而心放，或心勤而口慢，或学不弘博，攻伐师宗，形论万物，毁贤嫉圣，爱彼憎此，罔弱朋强。 或嗜酒耽色，亡神丧精。 或遇经不盟，窃看秘隐，轻减灵密，以示非类，传不关告，五岳无盟，皆为宣泄，犯考四明。 如此之人，徒有仙相，名书帝篇，行乖本根，更招考罚，上累七祖，罪灭其身，永失仙道，长充鬼役，轮转五苦，痛念何言。 高圣仙禁七伤之法 凡学士玄纪有名，身有仙相，自然合真，而心不坚正者，七败伤之。 第一之伤：带真行伪，淫色嚣神，耗液泄漏，精光枯乾，炁散魄零，骨空形残，神泣穷府，上闻天关，真仙远游，魔魅来干，自与幽阴，玄纪除名，九狱结因，六天相亲，沦苦无极，岂复得仙。 第二之伤：外形在道，皮好念真，心抱阴贼，凶恶素坚，愿人否败，嫉能妬贤，口美心逆，面喜内瞋，形论得失，好结罪源，毁谤伺学，攻讦宗根，三官所记，标为恶门，仙真弃置，邪鬼附身，走作形影，飞能体神，故令枉横，极其恶缘，考满形灭，魂沉九泉，徒有玄名，岂保自然。

Feasting above in the Mysterious Capital,

A numinous chariot with feathered canopy shall welcome their bodies to fly through the Mysterious Void, their rank elevated in the Immortal Realm.

If kept secret, the numinous shall descend; if divulged, the body shall perish. Practicing falsely or without sincerity shall implicate the seven ancestors in punishment, never to be absolved. The practitioner’s own life shall be forfeit, and they shall never again attain immortality.

Those of aspiration must guard this text with utmost secrecy.

Their primordial qi shall be received and awakened in the Spirit Chart, their virtue and power manifesting in union with the immortals. Internally, they shall resonate with the Supreme Ultimate’s illumination; externally, they shall encompass the Great Artisan’s lineage. When their merit is complete and their Dao perfected, they shall naturally ascend to heaven in broad daylight.

Some may maintain a disciplined form yet harbor a dissolute mind, or be diligent in heart yet careless in speech. Some may lack broad learning, attacking their teachers and sects, critiquing the myriad things, slandering the worthy and envying the sagely. They may favor some while resenting others, oppressing the weak and flattering the strong. Some may indulge in wine and lust, dissipating their spirit and losing their essence. Some may encounter scriptures without taking vows, secretly reading hidden texts, carelessly revealing numinous secrets to the unworthy, or transmitting without proper authorization, failing to pledge to the Five Peaks. All such acts constitute divulgence, incurring the punishment of the Four Luminaries.

Such individuals may bear the semblance of immortals, their names inscribed in the Emperor’s chapters, yet their conduct deviates from the root. They shall incur punishment and retribution, implicating their seven ancestors. Their bodies shall be destroyed, and they shall forever lose the Dao of immortality, eternally consigned to ghostly servitude, cycling through the Five Sufferings. The Most High’s Prohibitions on the Seven Injuries to Immortality

Recorded by the Three Offices, they shall be marked as gates of evil. The immortals shall abandon them, and malevolent ghosts shall possess their bodies, compelling them to act as shadows and fly as demons. Hun and po scatter and flee, inner and outer decay their numinous essence. The original chamber grows desolate, the Red Child wails in sorrow. The perfected immortals ascend far away, demonic spirits enter the body. Though such a one may accumulate sincerity, though their name be recorded in the Mysterious Register, they shall ultimately lose their jade name. Their spirit shall be confined to the Six Palaces, their body reduced to ashes in the dark underworld. Seeking longevity thus, how can their years endure?

The Fourth Harm: Conduct lacking in magnanimity and purity, demanding reverence from others while harboring resentment in the heart and curses on the tongue, delighting in contention. Joy and anger lack restraint, the nature remains unsettled. Qi surges wildly, scattering the inner perfected. Po departs, hun wanders, inviting calamity and illness. Years and lifespan decline and perish, all due to one’s nature. The perfected immortals ascend on high, while manifold afflictions assail the body. Though one may study diligently, this misfortune cannot be avoided. The hope of immortality grows ever more distant, while the days in hell lengthen.

The Fifth Harm: Having one’s name appear in the Mysterious Charts and receiving precious scriptures, or encountering a numinous master who imparts divine texts—yet failing to follow the precepts and covenants, revealing Heaven’s true essence. Before nine years have passed, one submits petitions to famous mountains, causing the Azure Palace to record their name and the Golden Watchtower to compile their deeds. Then, transmitting these teachings to others, scattering them among the world, treating the true lightly and leaking the precious. The consequences of this transgression shall bind one’s own body. Though their name may be recorded in the Mysterious Register, it shall instead burden the Seven Mysteries. The immortal Dao ascends on high, while their body dies and sinks into the dark springs, forever bearing ghostly retribution, never to be absolved for ten thousand kalpas.

The Sixth Harm: The body treading in filth and impurity, form and shadow lacking fragrance. Within, there is no purity and emptiness; without, no orchid-like fragrance. The Dao does not descend the true, the spirits do not dwell in their chambers. Qi is disturbed, essence is turbid, the numinous origin loses its radiance. The Five Spirits advance and scatter, the Red Child flees. Demonic evil attacks, bringing calamity within and without. Pursuing the Dao thus, seeking benefit only brings harm. The perfected immortals ascend far away, leaving only the corpse to wander alone. Sinking into irredeemable ruin, how can immortality be achieved?

The Seventh Harm: Consuming flesh that contains blood, slaughtering creatures to satisfy the mouth. Foul stench fills the viscera, harming life and injuring others. True qi is disturbed at the numinous gate, the wandering hun startles the Red Child. Hun and po depart from their palaces, filth and turbidity cling to the mouth and teeth. The perfected immortals abandon them in the clouds, while their own body sinks and stagnates in the earth. Though their name may be recorded in the Emperor’s jade registers, they shall ultimately not escape the death of the form.

The Most High Sage Emperor says: The foundation of learning lies in urgently guarding against the Seven Harms. Having gained the opportunity to gaze upon the gates of the Grotto-Heavens and peruse the jade scriptures, if one does not violate the prohibitions of the Seven Harms, one may sit and await the descent of the numinous, ascending at dawn on a white sun.

If, however, one diligently studies outwardly yet inwardly violates the Seven Harms, this shall lead to seeking immortality but instead meeting defeat, hoping for life but instead facing death, desiring fortune but instead encountering misfortune, aspiring to flight but instead sinking. The numinous immortals wander in the highest purity, while the Five Spirits scatter to the eight wilds. The Red Child wails and weeps in the central chamber, the wandering hun laments in the dark emptiness.

Thus, the signs of immortality may succeed or fail, and in the highest learning, there are the Seven Harms. Those who earnestly esteem the Dao must thoroughly refine their true essence.

The Most High Sage Emperor says: Those with jade bones and cinnabar script, whose names are listed in the Emperor’s charts, may behold the *Mysterious Register of the Seven Sages*. Those with golden marrow and purple treasuries, whose names are inscribed on golden tablets, may behold the hidden texts and inner scriptures. Those with extraordinary and wondrous features, purple wombs and jade networks, whose names are marked in the *Highest Clarity*, may behold the *White Tablet Jade Scriptures*. Those whose flowing essence emits purple radiance, whose inner and outer being is numinous, whose precious treasuries hold golden countenances, whose names are inscribed in the *Jade Void*, may behold the texts of the *Azure Register*. Those who are divinely outstanding and respond to the realm, with jade embryos and purple voids, whose names are inscribed in the *Eastern Florescence*, may behold the *Examination Text of the Seven Harms*.

Without such outstanding qualities, the numinous scriptures must not be rashly perused, nor the precious texts casually viewed. Those who behold these texts possess a mysterious essence that harmonizes with immortality. After nine years of cultivation, they shall attain flight through the dark void, ascending to the *Jade Clarity*.

When receiving the *Mysterious Register of the Seven Sages*, the *Nine Skies White Tablet*, or the *Azure Register*, master and disciple shall face each other in purification for ninety days, or thirty days. The disciple shall present seven taels of gold, seventy bolts of purple silk, and seven taels of cinnabar, approaching the master facing north to report their destiny to the Most High Sage. They shall transmit the texts after swearing an oath to Heaven.

If the master transmits without an oath, lightly leaking the precious texts, or if the disciple receives them without faith, recklessly perusing the jade scriptures, both shall suffer the judgment of the wind-blade, their seven ancestors burdened with retribution. They shall endure the Three Paths and Five Sufferings, never to be absolved for ten thousand kalpas. The divine soldiers of the Five Emperors shall constantly pursue those who leak the texts. Be clear and cautious in upholding these teachings.

Here ends the *Scripture of the Seven Sages’ Mysterious Register for Returning to the Nine Skies of Highest Clarity and Jade Emperor*.
